pr_title: GEODE-8073: Fix NPE after FetchKeysMessage failed.

timeline.message: GEODE-8073: Fix NPE after FetchKeysMessage failed.

timeline.bodyText: The exception isn't ignored, so it shouldn't be called "ignore."
timeline.author: DonalEvans

replies.bodyText: The exception was caught here, but the exception is itself being ignored. Seems that this was particularly changed to ignore in a previous checkin. Does this needs to change back definitely?
replies.author: pivotal-eshu

replies.bodyText: Ah, I see. We may catch the exception, but we don't actually do anything with it, even though we do something if we catch it. This name is fine as it is.
replies.author: DonalEvans

timeline.bodyText: Here you should use a real Set instead of a mock.
timeline.author: DonalEvans

replies.bodyText: I'd like to know the reason why this has to be a real Set.
replies.author: pivotal-eshu

timeline.bodyText: It's best not to mock Collections. It's fine to just use an actual Set here.
timeline.author: DonalEvans

replies.bodyText: The mocked failures as a set is used later to verify whether a method is invoked on the set. Otherwise it would be hard to verify.
replies.author: pivotal-eshu

replies.bodyText: Instead of verifying the method call on the mocked set, you can verify the contents of the real set, which should contain one item, which is the Integer 1.
replies.author: DonalEvans

timeline.bodyText: Here you should use a real Set instead of a mock.
timeline.author: DonalEvans

replies.bodyText: Is that a particular reason set should not be mocked? It is not being iterated through, just used as a placeholder. I would like to know the reason for the requested change so that I may gain some new knowledge.
replies.author: pivotal-eshu

replies.bodyText: It's part of the "don't mock what you don't own" principle in TDD, explained here and here. Also, as discussed here, if you can avoid mocking a class, as in this case, then that's probably a good thing.
replies.author: DonalEvans

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the explanation. Change has been made.
replies.author: pivotal-eshu
